title: Fresh Air Remembers Charlie Sifford, Who Broke Barriers In Golf
teaser: Sifford died Tuesday at 92. During his career, he won more than $1 million and was the first black golfer inducted into the World Golf Hall of Fame. He spoke with Terry Gross in 1992.
contentencoded: Copyright 2015 NPR. To see more, visit http://www.npr.org/.
